text: It's suspect, but we all spend the day trying to obtain info that others don't have, and dozens of horses a day are quietly held back because a lower rating has more potential value than a few hundred in price money. That's how horse racing has been since about 1780.

elements.text: It's suspect, but we all spend the day trying to obtain info that others don't have, and dozens of horses a day are quietly held back because a lower rating has more potential value than a few hundred in price money. That's how horse racing has been since about 1780.

text: The handicapping system was introduced in 1915 <@UEA14GBRR>
That was just an embarrassing joke btw
I feel very embarrassed for you
Nice quiz knowledge <@U01EZ613ZCZ> :slightly_smiling_face: I just mean that it's been shady ever since two people decided to wager a guinea.

elements.text: I just mean that it's been shady ever since two people decided to wager a guinea.

text: It’s a very interesting topic to expand on I think. For the amount of people who would assert the game is made up of sinister plots I think it’s actually a lot straighter than people would imagine.
The form book is still the most reliable indicator to a horses chances, I believe.
I'm playing devil's advocate as usual Graham, it's like the world over, most doing their best to play the game and a few dodgy buggers looking for angles.  :face_with_raised_eyebrow:

elements.text: I'm playing devil's advocate as usual Graham, it's like the world over, most doing their best to play the game and a few dodgy buggers looking for angles.

text: I think devils advocate is useful here.
I tried to pitch the BHA a way of probabilistically representing these “dodgy buggers” with a view to investigating non triers, etc.
They're just animals and it's sometimes hard to know what's not trying, the jockey or the horse.
